D.title: Lesson 1: I want (eggs), please.
D.intro: Let's meet our new friends, Felix and Cleo. They are brother and sister, and they are twins! They are five years old. How old are you? Wow! Good job. Now. I'm hungry. What's for breakfast?
D.dialog:
Mom: What do you want?
Cleo: I want eggs, please.

D.title: Lesson 1: Extra Vocabulary
D.dialog: This is my book.

D.title: Lesson 1: You have a big (yard).
D.dialog:
Angela: Here we are. This is our home.
Yuki: Wow! You have a big yard.
Angela: Do you think so?
Yuki: Yeah!
D.mainLanguage:
A: You have a big (yard).
B: Do you think so?

D.title: Lesson 2: Do you have any pets?
D.dialog:
Yuki: Do you have any pets?
Mia: Yes, I have a cat. Her name is Pudding.
Yuki: That's a funny name.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Do you have any pets?
B: Yes, I have a (cat). OR B: No, I don't.

D.title: Lesson 3: I got some chocolate.
D.dialog:
Ryan: Did you enjoy trick or treating?
Yuki: Yeah, it was fun!
Angela: What did you get?
Yuki: I got some chocolate.
D.mainLanguage:
A: What did you get?
B: I got some chocolate.

D.title: Lesson 4: Review.
D.dialog: Yuki: I'm so full.

D.title: Lesson 5: What are we going to do?
D.dialog:
Hina: What's the next class?
Jake: P.E.
Hina: What are we going to do?
Jake: We're going to play dodgeball.
D.mainLanguage:
A: What are we going to do?
B: We're going to play (dodgeball).

D.title: Lesson 6: (She)'s from (Russia).
D.dialog:
Hina: Who's that?
Jake: That's Kat. She just moved here.
Hina: Yeah? Where's she from?
Jake: She's from Russia.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Where's (she) from?
B: (She)'s from (Russia).

D.title: Lesson 7: I play hockey.
D.dialog:
Hina: Hi! I'm Hina.
Kat: Hi, Hina. My name's Katrina. Call me Kat.
Hina: Do you play any sports?
Kat: Yes, I play hockey.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Do you play any sports?
B: Yes, I play (hockey). OR B: No, I don't.

D.title: Lesson 8: Review.
D.dialog: Jake: Go, Kat!

D.title: Lesson 9: Can I get (a hamburger), please?
D.dialog:
Staff: Hello.
Hina: Hello. Can I get a hamburger, please?
Staff: Okay. Anything else?
Hina: Yes. Some fries, please.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Can I get (a hamburger), please?
B: Okay.

D.title: Lesson 10: It's very (crowded) here.
D.dialog:
Hina: It's very crowded here.
Jim: Yeah. Let's go outside. There might be a table.
Jake: Okay!
D.mainLanguage:
A: It's very (crowded) here.
B: Yeah.

D.title: Lesson 11: There's no (ketchup).
D.dialog:
Hina: I'm so hungry.
Jake: Me too. Oh no!
Jim: What's wrong?
Jake: There's no ketchup.
D.mainLanguage:
A: What's wrong?
B: There's no (ketchup).
OR
B: There are no (straws).

D.title: Lesson 12: Review.
D.dialog: Hina: Let's eat.

D.title: Lesson 13: Is your (mom) going to come?
D.dialog:
Jake: It's Career Day today.
Kat: Is your mom going to come?
Jake: No, but my grandpa is.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Is your (mom) going to come?
B: Yes, (he/she) is. OR B: No, but my (grandpa) is.

D.title: Lesson 14: (He)'s a librarian.
D.dialog:
Hina: How old is your grandpa?
Jake: He's 63.
Kat: Yeah? What does he do?
Jake: He's a librarian.
D.mainLanguage:
A: What does (he) do?
B: (He)'s a librarian.

D.title: Lesson 15: (He) works at (an elementary school).
D.dialog:
Kat: Does your grandpa work at the City Library?
Jake: No, he doesn't.
Hina: Where does he work?
Jake: He works at an elementary school.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Where does (he) work?
B: (He) works at (an elementary school).

D.title: Lesson 16: Review.
D.dialog: Hina: Your grandpa is really cool!

D.title: Lesson 17: Does this bus go to the (zoo)?
D.dialog:
Hina: Does this bus go to the zoo?
Bus driver: Yes, it does.
Jake: Thank you. Come on. Let's get on.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Does this bus go to the (zoo)?
B: Yes, it does. OR B: No, it doesn't.

D.title: Lesson 18: I lost my (ticket).
D.dialog:
Jake: Oh no!
Hina: What's the matter?
Jake: I lost my ticket.
Kat: Really?
D.mainLanguage:
A: What's the matter?
B: I lost my (ticket).

D.title: Lesson 19: Is it (on) the seat?
D.dialog:
Hina: Is it on the seat?
Jake: No, it isn't.
Kat: Check under the seat.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Is it (on) the seat?
B: Yes, it is. OR B: No, it isn't.

D.title: Lesson 20: Review.
D.dialog: Jake: I found it!

D.title: Lesson 21: It'll be (hot) tomorrow.
D.dialog:
Hina: What's the forecast?
Amanda: It'll be hot tomorrow.
Jake: Yeah? Great!
D.mainLanguage:
A: What's the forecast?
B: It'll be (hot) tomorrow.

D.title: Lesson 22: Do you have your (hat)?
D.dialog:
Amanda: Are you ready?
Hina: I think so.
Jim: Do you have your hat?
Hina: Yes, I do.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Do you have your (hat)?
B: Yes, I do. OR B: No, I don't.

D.title: Lesson 23: Are there any (bears)?
D.dialog:
Hina: Are there any bears?
Jim: No. Just squirrels and racoons.
Amanda: That's good.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Are there any (bears)?
B: I think so. OR B: No.

D.title: Lesson 24: Review.
D.dialog: Hina: It's so beautiful here!

D.title: Lesson 1: They're (wings).
D.dialog:
Jake: What are you drawing?
Hina: A butterfly.
Jake: What are these?
Hina: They're wings.
D.mainLanguage:
A: What are these?
B: They're (wings).

D.title: Lesson 2: (Three).
D.dialog:
Jake: I'm drawing Easter eggs.
Hina: Nice! How many have you drawn?
Jake: Three.
D.mainLanguage:
A: How many have you drawn?
B: (Three).

D.title: Lesson 3: Put away the (crayons), please.
D.dialog:
Teacher: Put away the crayons, please.
Hina: Okay. Where do they go?
Teacher: In the bottom drawer.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Put away the (crayons), please.
B: Okay.

D.title: Lesson 5: Why don't you like (softball)?
D.dialog:
Jake: Come on! We're going to play softball.
Hina: No, thanks. I don't want to play.
Jake: Why don't you like softball?
Hina: I can't hit.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Why don't you like (softball)?
B: I can't (hit).

D.title: Lesson 6: (She)'s really (nice).
D.dialog:
Jake: Did you meet Kat?
Hina: Not yet. What's she like?
Jake: She's really nice.
Hina: Let's go say hi.
D.mainLanguage:
A: What's (she) like?
B: (She)'s really (nice).

D.title: Lesson 7: Yes, I play the (cello).
D.dialog:
Jake: Hi! I'm Jake.
Kat: Hi, Jake. I'm Kat.
Hina: Do you play any instruments?
Kat: Yes, I play the cello.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Do you play any instruments?
B: Yes, I play the (cello).

D.title: Lesson 9: I'll have (vanilla), please.
D.dialog:
Staff: Anything else?
Hina: A shake, please.
Staff: What flavor?
Hina: I'll have vanilla, please.
D.mainLanguage:
A: What flavor?
B: I'll have (vanilla), please.

D.title: Lesson 10: Let's sit (at the counter).
D.dialog:
Hina: It's cold out here. Let's go inside.
Jim: Okay. Let's sit at the counter.
Hina: Sounds good.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Let's sit (at the counter).
B: Sounds good.

D.title: Lesson 11: It has (pickles).
D.dialog:
Jake: Uh oh!
Jim: What's wrong?
Jake: It has pickles.
Hina: Yuck.
D.mainLanguage:
A: What's wrong?
B: It has (pickles).

D.title: Lesson 13: There. In the blue (jacket).
D.dialog:
Kat: Is you mom here?
Jake: Yes.
Kat: Where is she?
Jake: There. In the blue jacket.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Where is (she)?
B: There. In the blue (jacket).

D.title: Lesson 14: (She)'s (thirty-nine).
D.dialog:
Kat: What does your mom do?
Jake: She's a chef.
Kat: How old is she?
Jake: She's thirty-nine.
D.mainLanguage:
A: How old is (she)?
B: (She)'s (thirty-nine).

D.title: Lesson 15: (She) can (draw).
D.dialog:
Jake: Can your mom cook?
Kat: Not really.
Jake: What can she do?
Kat: She can draw.
D.mainLanguage:
A: What can (she) do?
B: (She) can (draw).

D.title: Lesson 17: Does this (bus) go to the beach?
D.dialog:
Hina: Does this bus go to the beach?
Bus driver: No, it doesn't. You need that one.
Jake: Okay. Thank you!
D.mainLanguage:
A: Does this (bus) go to the beach?
B: Yes, it does. OR B: No, it doesn't.

D.title: Lesson 18: It was (in my pocket).
D.dialog:
Jake: Oh no! I lost my ticket.
Hina: Where was it?
Jake: It was in my pocket.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Where was it?
B: It was (in my pocket).

D.title: Lesson 19: At the (long bridge).
D.dialog:
Jake: I found my ticket!
Hina: Good.
Jake: Where do we get off?
Kat: At the long bridge.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Where do we get off?
B: At the (long bridge).

D.title: Lesson 21: It might rain (in the morning).
D.dialog:
Amanda: It'll be cloudy tomorrow.
Jake: Oh. Will it rain?
Amanda: It might rain in the morning.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Will it rain?
B: It might rain (in the morning).

D.title: Lesson 22: Put on your (backpack), please.
D.dialog:
Amanda: Are you ready?
Hina: Yes, I am.
Jim: All right. Put on your backpack, please.
Hina: Okay.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Put on your (backpack), please.
B: Okay.

D.title: Lesson 23: Is it (a squirrel)?
D.dialog:
Jake: What's that noise?
Hina: Is it a squirrel?
Jim: No, it's an owl.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Is it (a squirrel)?
B: Maybe. OR B: No, it's (an owl).

D.title: Lesson 1: Who's using the (tape)?
D.dialog:
Olivia: Who's using the tape?
Kota: I am.
Olivia: Can I have it after you?
Kota: Okay.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Who's using the (tape)?
B: (Doug) is.
OR
B: I am.

D.title: Lesson 2: May I (go to the bathroom), please?
D.dialog:
Riz: Ms. Brown, may I go to the bathroom, please?
Teacher: Sure.
Kota: May I go too? I want to wash my hands.
Teacher: Okay.
D.mainLanguage:
A: May I (go to the bathroom), please?
B: Sure. OR B: Sorry, you can't.

D.title: Lesson 3: The (first one from the left).
D.dialog:
Kota: Can you guess which one is mine?
Riz: Let's see. The second one from the right?
Kota: That's right! Which one is yours?
Riz: The first one from the left.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Which one is yours?
B: The (first one from the left).

D.title: Lesson 4: Review.
D.dialog: Teacher: Great job, everyone!

D.title: Lesson 1: I need more (tape).
D.dialog:
Olivia: I need more tape.
Kota: There's another roll here.
Olivia: Okay. Thank you.
D.mainLanguage:
A: I need more (tape).
B: There's another (roll) here.

D.title: Lesson 2: I have (a stomachache).
D.dialog:
Riz: Ms. Brown. May I go to the nurse's office?
Ms. Brown: What's wrong?
Riz: I have a stomachache.
Ms. Brown: All right. I'll write you a hall pass.
D.mainLanguage:
A: What's wrong?
B: I have (a stomachache).

D.title: Lesson 3: The one with the (spots).
D.dialog:
Kota: Which one's yours?
Riz: The one with the spots. How about you?
Kota: The one with the stripes.
Riz: It looks really cool.
Kota: Thanks!
D.mainLanguage:
A: Which one's yours?
B: The one with the (spots).

D.title: Lesson 1: You (should) (go to bed early).
D.dialog:
Peter: Are you ok?
Taiki: Not really. I feel terrible.
Peter: You should go to bed early.
Taiki: Okay.
D.mainLanguage:
A: You (should / shouldn't) (go to bed early).
B: Okay.

D.title: Lesson 2: (He) (might) be at (rugby practice).
D.dialog:
Taiki: Peter, where's Alex.
Peter: He might be at rugby practice.
Susan: There's no rugby practice today.
Peter: Then he must be at a friend's house.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Where's (Alex)?
B: (He) (might / must) be at (rugby practice).

D.title: Lesson 3: Can I skip (doing the dishes) (tonight)?
D.dialog:
Alex: Mom, can I skip doing the dishes tonight?
Susan: Why? Are you going out?
Alex: I want to go to the movies with my friends.
Susan: All right. Have fun.
Taiki: I'll help with the dishes.
D.mainLanguage:
A: Can I skip (doing the dishes) (tonight)?
B: All right. OR B: No, you can't.

D.title: Lesson 4: Review.
D.dialog:
Jessica: Dad, can I skip watering the plants today? I want to meet my friends.
Peter: No, you can't. You should water the plants and then do your homework.
Jessica: But Taiki and Nikau might be at the park already.

D.title: Lesson 1: I'll get you (some soup).
D.dialog:
Peter: What's wrong?
Taiki: I have a cold.
Peter: You should stay home. I'll get you some soup.
Taiki: Thank you.
D.mainLanguage:
A: I'll get you (some soup).
B: Thank you.

D.title: Lesson 2: (They're) (studying for a test).
D.dialog:
Taiki: Where's Alex?
Peter: He's at John's house.
Taiki: What are they doing?
Peter: They're studying for a test.
D.mainLanguage:
A: (What are) (they) doing?
B: (They're) (studying for a test).

D.title: Lesson 3: (Friday) is (plastics).
D.dialog:
Susan: Alex, can you take out the trash?
Alex: Sure. What goes out on Friday?
Susan: Friday is plastics.
Alex: Got it.
Taiki: I'll help too!
D.mainLanguage:
A: What goes out on (Friday)?
B: (Friday) is (plastics).
